channel.title: The Economic Times
channel.description: The Economic Times: Latest business, finance, markets, stocks, company news from India.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C)Sun 25 Jun 2017, 12:56:502017Sun 25 Jun 2017, 12:56:50 Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://info.indiatimes.com/terms/tou.html

item.title: Subtle message for Trump in PM Modi's huddle with CEOs
item.description: Subtle message for Trump in PM Modi's huddle with CEOsThe Modi jamboree is also hosting a relatively low-key community event at the Ritz-Carlton in Tyson's Corner, across the river from Washington DC.

item.title: Job market eyes GST booster for over 1 lakh immediate openings
item.description: Job market eyes GST booster for over 1 lakh immediate openingsThe tax reform, to be rolled out from July 1, is expected to help the formal job sector attain an annualised growth rate of 10-13% and fuel demand for professionals.

item.title: Why RSS agreed on Ram Nath Kovind as BJP's choice for Raisina Hill
item.description: Why RSS agreed on Ram Nath Kovind as BJP's choice for Raisina HillKovind’s nomination is a step forward from Atal Bihari Vajpayee’s selection of APJ Abdul Kalam, grudgingly accepted by the RSS in 2002.

item.title: PM Modi gets warm welcome by Indians in US
item.description: PM Modi gets warm welcome by Indians in USAfter stopping briefly in front of the crowd, Narendra Modi, surrounded by Indian and American security officials, walked back towards his motorcade.

item.title: 'Aadhaar not valid for travel to Nepal, Bhutan'
item.description: 'Aadhaar not valid for travel to Nepal, Bhutan'The advisory assumes significance as Aadhaar is mandatory for a host of things, including government subsidies on LPG and other social welfare schemes.

item.title: Jab they meet: What Trump may tell Modi
item.description: Jab they meet: What Trump may tell ModiPM Modi, in saffron waistcoat and a cream silk kurta, enters the Oval Office. Given that this is a one-on-one meeting, no aides are present. Trump is busy checking his Twitter notifications.

item.title: PM recalls Emergency, pitches for strong democracy
item.description: PM recalls Emergency, pitches for strong democracyPM Modi said it was essential to remember the incidents which have caused harm to democracy and move ahead towards the positives of democracy.

item.title: Reddy wanted to quit over row with Chidambaram
item.description: Reddy wanted to quit over row with ChidambaramReddy, who was Reserve Bank governor from September 2003 to September 2008, shared an uncomfortable relationship with Chidambaram.

item.title: Trump keeping Indians away from US colleges
item.description: Trump keeping Indians away from US collegesInternational student recruitment professionals, according to a report, found students and their families concerned over visas.

item.title: Why Oyo may be darkest horse in SoftBank's portfolio
item.description: Why Oyo may be darkest horse in SoftBank's portfolioUnder Ritesh Agarwal, Oyo has registered an exponential growth in India, growing from 105 rooms in 2014 to 70,000 rooms now.

item.title: Sale season starts on D-Street, soon buy stocks at discount
item.description: Analysis of midcap & smallcap indices indicate that it's time to book profit, sit on cash.

item.title: Weakening crude prices create bullish setup for aviation stocks
item.description: Crude oil prices have fallen about 20 per cent this year and have entered the bear zone.

item.title: Market Moguls: India may be legalising Bitcoin
item.description: Swedish are importing waste of major European countries and making money. This is futuristic.

item.title: Be selective in stock picking: BNP Paribas MF
item.description: Housing finance is among few pockets where we may have consistent sustainable earnings growth.

item.title: GST may be more disruptive than what you believe
item.description: Tandon said that transition to GST will be far more disruptive than the Street expectation.

item.title: When FTSE, MSCI and S&P rule the world
item.description: It's impossible not to wonder what strange consequences the dominance of passive investing will have on financial markets.

item.title: Western, southern states control over 60 per cent of bank credit: RBI
item.description: With Rs 41,70,600 crore of the total credit, the western and southern regions controlled as much as 60.6 per cent of the system as of financial year 2014-15.

item.title: GST switchover: Renaming CBEC as CBIC may take a while
item.description: With excise duty alongside nearly a dozen other central and state levies being taken over by the Goods and Services Tax (GST), the ambit of the CBEC is set to change and widen.

item.title: GST Clinics to help traders in smooth transition
item.description: The GST Clinics will be held in offices of trade associations, HDFC Bank branches or markets easily accessible to traders.

item.title: GST to make exports more competitive: Commerce Secy
item.description: Exporters get duty/tax credit scrips under the incentive schemes. These are kind of certificates which can be used to pay duties including import taxes.

item.title: Post-Brexit India-UK trade can be lot better: Indian envoy
item.description: There was consensus among the business and political leaders at the conference, held to coincide with the 1 year mark of the referendum on Britain's membership of the EU.

item.title: States' fiscal deficit soars to Rs 4.93 trillion in FY16
item.description: Uttar Pradesh had a fiscal deficit of a paltry Rs 3,070 crore in FY91, which zoomed to Rs 64,320 crore in FY16 and is projected to improve to Rs 49,960 crore in FY17.

item.title: Infosys Chairman R Seshasayee to retire next year
item.description: Seshasayee said the management commit to its shareholders further acceleration of efforts through "the daunting changes and deliver performance worthy of its proud heritage".

item.title: Google to stop scanning Gmail for ads personalization
item.description: Diane Greene, Google's Senior Vice President for Google Cloud, said the company made this decision because it "brings Gmail ads in line with how we personalize ads for other Google products", Tech Crunch reported on Friday.

item.title: OnePlus wants customs duty on imported smartphones deferred
item.description: Adequate time should be given to companies like OnePlus that sell only one model every year because a sudden increase in prices could drive away potential customers, a top executive said.

item.title: We just want to make the best android flagship: Pete Lau, Co-founder, OnePlus
item.description: Lau is hoping the new OnePlus 5 will follow the path of the OnePlus 3 and 3T, which were big successes in the premium smartphone segment.

item.title: Government, TRAI discuss policy; IMG brainstorms on telcos' demands
item.description: According to sources, the high-level meeting was held to discuss regulatory and policy issues in the sector and expedite the Bharat Net project.

item.title: Infosys to pay $1 million to settle case of visa violations in New York
item.description: The statement said that Infosys obtained B-1 visas, which are temporary visitor visas, instead of the H-1B work permit which was required.

item.title: 100 killed as oil tanker exploded in Pakistan's Bahwalpur
item.description: At least 100 people were killed and 75 others severely injured in the blaze, local media reported. People had gathered around the tanker after it overturned to collect oil that had leaked out.

item.title: 15 killed, 120 missing as landslide buries mountain village in China
item.description: The early morning landslide, which came from a mountain in Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous Prefecture of Aba, engulfed 62 homes and a hotel in Xinmo Village in Maoxian County.

item.title: Qatar says Saudi-led demands not 'reasonable'
item.description: The four Arab governments delivered the demands to Qatar through Kuwait, more than two weeks after severing all ties with the emirate and imposing an embargo.

item.title: Oil group Rosneft to continue dispute with Sistema in court
item.description: As the document does not contain any proposals on resolving the dispute, we will continue the proceedings in court as we wait for the court decision," Rosneft said.

item.title: BRICS countries reaffirm commitment to implement Paris deal
item.description: The officials reiterated their intention to promote cooperation within BRICS in the area of pollution prevention.

item.title: The new Saudi Arabian heir is a dangerous man
item.description: Mohammed bin Salman has been responsible for a more aggressive Saudi stance in regional affairs, moving from the policy of holding on to oil market share.

item.title: Aadhaar not valid for travel to Nepal, Bhutan: Home ministry
item.description: The advisory assumes significance as Aadhaar is mandatory for a host of things, including government subsidies on LPG and other social welfare schemes.

item.title: PM Narendra Modi gets warm welcome by Indians in US
item.description: After stopping briefly in front of the crowd, Narendra Modi, surrounded by Indian and American security officials, walked back towards his motorcade.

item.title: SP, BSP back Meira Kumar, consolidate anti-BJP forces in Uttar Pradesh
item.description: With the BJP making deep inroads into their respective bastions, the SP and the BSP have found in the presidential election another opportunity to come on the same page.

item.title: Yogi Adityanath government has become an 'inquiry committee': SP
item.description: As the state's BJP govt completes 100 days in the office in the next few days, a SP spokesperson said it was resorting to such tactics to "smokescreen its failures".

item.title: Jab they meet: What Donald Trump may tell Narendra Modi
item.description: PM Modi, in saffron waistcoat and a cream silk kurta, enters the Oval Office. Given that this is a one-on-one meeting, no aides are present. Trump is busy checking his Twitter notifications.

item.title: Government claims it helped 91% of scavengers, after ignoring 93% of them
item.description: Since 2013, states have been made responsible for identifying and rehabilitating manual scavengers by providing them training, giving assistance, loans and even houses.

item.title: Traders bet on calendar spread as Nifty moves in a tight range
item.description: A trading combination involving Nifty options is gaining prominence among savvy trading desks of institutional investors.

item.title: Nifty may find support at 5300 level
item.description: As far as stock futures are concerned, we are very near to the highest-ever open interest with 195 crore shares in open interest.

item.title: Seven out of top 10 Asian small-cap funds are Indian
item.description: An analysis of 300 Asian small-cap schemes shows DSP BlackRock Micro Cap Fund leading the charge, delivering an 82% return over the past year.

item.title: Inflation reflects growth dynamics in India: Christopher Wood
item.description: India has inflation and it reflects the fundamental growth, Christopher Wood, equity strategist, CLSA, said at ET Now Mkt Summit-2010.

item.title: Market may trade in a range, but FIIs seen sold on India
item.description: Market may see range-bound trading this week in the absence of any major trigger.

item.title: 'Don't bank only on price-to-earning ratio'
item.description: Many experts believe that looking at PE ratio in isolation won’t help investors grasp realities of the mkt and higher valuation may not be the only deciding factor driving mkt.

item.title: Prabhudas Lilladher has a reduce rating on Infosys
item.description: Prabhudas Lilladher has a ‘reduce’ rating on Infosys Technologies as it feels that the outlook for the company and the software industry is quite weak in the near-term.

item.title: Fin Crisis: Too late and too little done in US
item.description: A crisis of $240 trillion cannot be stemmed with bailout packages of $1 to $10 trillion. 2008: Year of global financial crisis | Survive credit crisis | Ghosts of 1929

item.title: Weak rupee takes its toll on cos with huge foreign debt
item.description: The falling rupee will severely affect the small companies, whereas the big ones will be impacted moderately. Get rid of Debt | Adopt correct investment strategies

item.title: Wait for more signals before turning positive
item.description: At the recent low of 12514 points, the Sensex has tested the 12800-12000-pts support zone and has since then attempted a corrective rally.

item.title: Six Indian cos among BusinessWeek's top 100 Infotech firms
item.description: BusinessWeek's 'The Infotech 100', has ranked Bharti Airtel at the 21st position followed by Reddington India (55th) and RCom (66th). Successful business formula

item.title: Indian firms slip in global ranking; four move out of Top-500
item.description: 14 firms present in a new list of world's 500 most valued firms together seeing an erosion of about $150 billion in their market value in the first three months of this year.

item.title: 'Big Daddy' laps up Cipla after Q1 nos beat forecast
item.description: Shares of Cipla inched up on heavy volumes on Friday, after the company’s first quarter earnings beat the consensus estimate.

item.title: Old Fox has dream run on Dalal Street
item.description: The Old Fox of Dalal Street has been on a dream run since the past couple of weeks. On Friday, most stocks that he had been steadily building up positions in figured among key gainers of the day.

item.title: Cairn India hits record high on BSE amid stake sale talks
item.description: The scrip, which was flat for most of the session, shot up in the final hour of trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange to settle with a net gain of 4.36 per cent at Rs 355.45.

item.title: Vedanta plunges 5.59% on LSE amid talks to buy Cairn stake
item.description: In the late afternoon session, the scrip was being traded at 20.61 pounds, down by 5.50 per cent on the LSE. Vedanta opened on a positive note, but soon swung into the red.

item.title: SBI shares on gaining spree; hit record high
item.description: In the past two days, the scrip recorded a gain of over 9 per cent on the BSE, making its investors richer by a whopping Rs 15,000 crore.

item.title: FM must rethink
item.description: TT Ram Mohan has rightly suggested that the tax-GDP ratio measures structural improvement. The FM must rethink his medium-term debtto-GDP target.

item.title: Amalgamate banks
item.description: Financial inclusion and financial literacy will be the paramount objective while implementing reforms along with UID project to protect the interests of poor.

item.title: Managing data
item.description: This refers to your edit ‘A welcome quest’ (ET, Oct 8). It is imperative to have a strong database.

item.title: Right technology
item.description: Apropos of ‘The climate conundrum’ (ET, Oct 9), Mukul Sanwal rightly suggests that developing countries should lead in setting the agenda for global technological cooperation.

item.title: ET Search
item.description: Rupee#CAD#Economic crisis#Food Bill

item.title: After the Oscars, what's next for silent stars of The Artist?
item.description: The team behind The Artist will have spent the first day of the rest of their lives conforming to the grandest, and most lucrative, of Hollywood traditions.

item.title: Delhi World Book fair: A fair like no other
item.description: It's the World Book fair, which comes around once every two years sprawling across the giant halls of Pragati Maidan. This is the fair's 20th edition.

item.title: Indian gift makes its way to State Department exhibition
item.description: An elephant figurine gifted by the then HM LK Advani to US Secretary of State Colin Powell in 2002, has made its way to the State Department hall.

item.title: IMD to use dynamic models for forecasts
item.description: Statistical models used by IMD will still be used for monsoon forecast, but the ministry of earth sciences is putting more emphasis on dynamic models.

item.title: Docs reveal contents of first wire msg between India & Eng
item.description: Newly discovered documents have revealed the first telegraph messages and joy when England was linked for the first time with India on 23 June, 1870.

item.title: Worried Amitabh Bachchan fans pray to Lord Shiva for his recovery
item.description: Hundreds of worried fans of ailing Bollywood megastar Amitabh Bachchan today performed a yagna here to pray for his speedy recovery.

item.title: Every decision of government needn’t be a big reform: Anand Mahindra
item.description: "The fact that we are the world’s largest democracy and we are all aware that power and a role in global affairs for a nation comes from economic strength."

item.title: Narendra Modi has his eyes set on boosting business: Joao Cravinho, EU Ambassador
item.description: Ambassador Joao Cravinho, head of the EU delegation, led Ambassadors of various European countries to a quiet lunch with Modi at the capital last year.

item.title: Confidence level of industry improving: KV Kamath, ICICI Bank
item.description: "It is the collective wisdom of the marketplace that there is action and we will move with speed. That improves the confidence level of industry."

item.title: We may see rapid growth over the next few years: Raamdeo Agrawal
item.description: Directives from the Centre have to be executed at the state level. So, there are many things that are not in Modi’s hands, says Raamdeo Agrawal.

item.title: Our commitment for press freedom, and autonomy of public broadcast is absolute: Prakash Javadekar
item.description: "Now there is a stage three and stage four of digitisation, we will take a call on this only after taking all things into account."

item.title: There is a leadership vacuum in Infosys, time to get Nandan Nilekani back: Mohandas Pai
item.description: "There is a leadership vacuum in the company, because they made the wrong choice of CEO three years ago and that is playing out right now."

item.title: Opening Bell: Top cues that changed your market while you were sleeping
item.description: TCS, India’s largest technology firm by revenue, on Tuesday reported a 2.5 per cent sequential drop in net profit at Rs 6,608 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2017.

item.title: Uber merging China ops with Didi in $35 bn deal
item.description: Uber will reportedly continue to operate its own app in China for now. Uber declined to comment on this to the publication.

item.title: Jinping under pressure for strong SC Sea response
item.description: Some elements within China's military are pushing for a stronger - potentially armed - response aimed at United States and its regional allies.

item.title: No government accommodation for former CMs: SC
item.description: The apex court also directed six former chief ministers of Uttar Pradesh to vacate government houses allotted to them.

item.title: Manufacturing PMI at 4 month high of 51.8 in July
item.description: The seasonally adjusted Nikkei India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index edged higher in July, at 51.8 compared with 51.7 in June.

item.title: Scooter's back, with new hero on road
item.description: Slowing rural demand after two rain deficit years might be weighing down Splendor's sales but Honda says there is more to these results than El Nino.

item.title: Alfa raises delisting price to Rs 2,850 a share
item.description: Alfa Laval (India) today said its parent firm has raised the delisting offer price to Rs 2,850 a share.

item.title: DB Realty, Unitech stocks rose
item.description: The stocks of DB Realty and Unitech rose after top executives of these companies were granted bail in the 2G scam case.

item.title: Fitch withdraws Reliance Capital ratings
item.description: Fitch on Friday said it has withdrawn the ratings on Reliance Capital as the company has decided to stop participating.

item.title: 'Discoms' poor fin health poses risks for traders'
item.description: The poor financial health of state electricity boards could pose significant business risks for power traders in the country, says Fitch.

item.title: Cigarette cos shares outperform benchmark Sensex
item.description: Shares of cigarette companies have rallied over the past one month, with ITC, Godfrey Philips and VST Industries hitting record highs.

item.title: Lovable Lingerie's dream run on as traders lap it up
item.description: Lovable Lingerie is 3rd-best performing stock among companies listed this year, with it doubling in value, as traders bet it could repeat performance of Page Indus.
